author: deadpool7777777
content: the basefee is intended to spike with short term surges of usage and blocks are allowed to be larger for bursts to further alleviate congestion. The purpose of the tip is for really spiky demand so that people who are willing to pay large amounts don't have to wait for the base fee to go higher and to capture mev. The basefee has a cap on how quickly it can surge and drop because there are technical tradeoff with letting it go up or down too slowly or quickly. The tip is more of a release valve. Ideally it wouldn't be necessary but blockspace demand and mev are too volatile to not have a tip system.

author: deadpool7777777
content: also fee burning is valuable in its own right for game theory purposes (meaning other than just reducing issuance) because it forces on chain payment in eth instead of side channel payments and it reduces volatility of eth security budget because having fee dominated security budget as opposed to issuance dominated security introduces perverse incentives where it may be logical to attack to earn more money for miners/validators
